column1: Yellow fumes emerging from the earthâ€™s depths.
A field of eerie phosphorescent plant-like lifeforms.
A narrow valley carpeted with thorny vines.
A waterfall, thick and slimy and green with algae.
Yellow sulphuric clouds, forming strange patterns.
A soft, almost ash-like substance floating on the wind, sticking to all surfaces and dyeing them red.
Dozens of small creatures feeding off a large, days-old carcass.
Rock formations, corroded by the toxic elements, left with serrated edges and bone-like patterns.
The bleached bones of dozens of large creatures, somehow impervious to the elements.
Large clouds of insect-like creatures, far away but still clearly visible due to their number.
